Zone Connect by The Park Udaipur

24219.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today before we check-out. We’ll go on a sightseeing around Udaipur starting with the City Palace of Udaipur, Rajasthan’s largest royal complex where Kings used to call home. Visitors can explore the various mahals, courtyards and pavilions built in this complex. Up at the highest point of the complex is the Amar Vilas that’s known for the beautiful hanging gardens. We’ll then visit Fateh Prakash Palace as well, a breathtaking site with an amazing view. Check out the inside of the Krishna Vilas chamber that houses a collection of miniature paintings. The elegant Manak Mahal lives up to its name, adorned with many red colored glass and mosaic. The Mor Chowk is a beautiful court that was built during the reign of Rana Karan Singhji. The Sheesh Mahal is a luxurious hotel that’s a pride of Udaipur. Near the edge of the City Palace is the Zenana Mahal which has been restored as a hotel. It used to serve as the palace for the royal ladies. We also won’t miss out on Sheesh Mahal and Rang Bhawan that brags exquisite view.

Then we’ll head over to the Jagdish Temple in Udaipur, a Hindu temple that’s been worshipped since 1651. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu who’s also known as the preserver of the universe. It is a Mewar dynasty’s architectural achievement as the 79-feet tall structure adorn the skyline of Udaipur.

Then visit Vintage Car Museum where any vintage car enthusiasts will love to check out their antique car collection. There are around 20 of them with 4 Rolls-Royce’s, 2 Cadillacs, and a lot of convertibles.

We’ll make a photo stop at Nehru Garden which is located on an island within Fateh Sagar Lake. Enjoy the tranquil atmosphere of the artificial lake surrounded by Aravalli Hills and the calming ride to the island in the middle. Nehru Garden is a floating restaurant with garden in the shape of a boat. Then we head to the gardens on the banks of Fateh Sagar Lake, Saheliyon-Ki-Bari, the Courtyard of Maiden. These gardens are built under the embankment of the lake and has beautiful lotus pools, marble pavilions and elephants, built in 1734 for the royal ladies. It was a present from Maharana Sangram Singh for his queen and her 48 maids.

The ride continues to the Ahmedabad Airport or Railway Station for your scheduled departure. We know you’re heading back home with smiles from the awesome experience of this trip!
24219.ttl: Udaipur Sightseeing & Transfer from Udaipur to Ahmedabad - Departure

105075.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast today before we set off on a day-excursion to Ranakpur, about 2-hour ride from Udaipur. Here, we’re going to visit the Chaumukha Jain Temple where believers worship Tirthankara Rishabhanatha. It is one of the largest Hindu temples in Jain, built in the 15th century by a local Jain businessman, Darna Shah. The construction involved over 2,700 workers and was said to have taken 50 years. One can see the work on 1444 non-replicable carvings on marble pillars with their own themes.

After exploring Ranakpur’s temple, we’ll ride back to Udaipur for your overnight stay at the hotel.

107412.dsc: Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today before we check-out. Get ready for your 7-hour ride that’ll take you directly to Khatauli Airport or Railway Station for your scheduled departure. We know you’re heading back home with smiles from the awesome experience of this trip!

4949-1_26082024.e: Choose a Transport option with drop at Khatauli

23442.dsc: Check out from the hotel & proceed towards Airport/Railway stations for your onwards journey.

118547.dsc:
Upon your arrival in Mount Abu, our representatives will greet and help with your luggage and transfer to your accommodation in Udaipur. Welcome to Udaipur, a city of royalties of ancient times known for the age-old temples, gorgeous lakes & gardens, and grandeur palaces & forts. We’ll immediately check-in after arriving at the hotel in Udaipur so you can rest.

Get ready for a half-day sightseeing around Udaipur to get a taste of the legacy and history of this city. We’ll start from the City Palace of Udaipur, Rajasthan’s largest royal complex where Kings used to call home. Visitors can explore the various mahals, courtyards and pavilions built in this complex. Up at the highest point of the complex is the Amar Vilas that’s known for the beautiful hanging gardens. We’ll then visit Fateh Prakash Palace as well, a breathtaking site with an amazing view. Check out the inside of the Krishna Vilas chamber that houses a collection of miniature paintings. The elegant Manak Mahal lives up to its name, adorned with many red colored glass and mosaic. The Mor Chowk is a beautiful court that was built during the reign of Rana Karan Singhji. The Sheesh Mahal is a luxurious hotel that’s a pride of Udaipur. Near the edge of the City Palace is the Zenana Mahal which has been restored as a hotel. It used to serve as the palace for the royal ladies. We also won’t miss out on Sheesh Mahal and Rang Bhawan that brags exquisite view. At additional cost, we’ll also take you visit the Crystal Art Gallery that’s inside the Fateh Prakash Palace to see their crystal collection. The collection is over hundreds of years old and include a variety of objects d’art, dinner sets, perfume bottles, glasses, and more. Next to the palace are the Dilkhush Mahal and Moti Mahal where you can see unique mosaic of peacocks, paintings, and corking mirror works.

Then we’ll head over to the Jagdish Temple in Udaipur, a Hindu temple that’s been worshipped since 1651. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu who’s also known as the preserver of the universe. It is a Mewar dynasty’s architectural achievement as the 79-feet tall structure adorn the skyline of Udaipur.

Prepare for an evening trip to Lake Pichola and at an extra cost, you can even boat through the waters to enjoy the view. As the sun slowly sinks in the horizon, it turns the lakeside buildings and your surrounding golden. You can see the City Palace in the east and the gardens in the south. Head back to the hotel afterward for your overnight stay in Udaipur.

5079-0_22082024.e: Choose a Transport option starting from Mount Abu

118547.ttl: Arrive at Udaipur from Mount Abu + Half Day Udaipur Sightseeing

19142.dsc: Spend the day at leisure. You can shop around in many markets of Jaipur or explore the historical places.

97511.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today before we check-out. Get ready for your 7-hour ride that’ll take you Udaipur Airport for your scheduled departure. Enroute, we’ll make some last stops to visit famous historical sites and temples. 

Ajmer and Pushkar, with Ajmer comparatively bigger than Pushkar. While we’re here, we’re going to visit Ajmer Sharif Dargah, the dargah of Moinuddin Chishti. This is the tomb of Moinuddin Chishti from the 13th century, who was highly venerated throughout his reputation after arriving Delhi and later, Ajmer. We’re not going to miss the main attraction of Pushkar, the Temple of Lord Brahma, also known as Jagatpita Brahman Mandir, one of the rare, ancient temples dedicated to the Hindu Creator God. And then a final stop to see the ancient fort and majestic palaces of Chittorgarh that dot the surrounding areas, bragging stunning views of the area.

The ride continues until we reach Udaipur Airport and bid you goodbye. We know you’re heading back home with smiles from the awesome experience of this trip!

4949-1_26082024.e: Choose a Transport option with drop at Udaipur

97511.ttl: Departure to Udaipur via Ajmer, Pushkar and Chittorgarh

105074.dsc: Upon your arrival in Jaipur, our representatives will greet and help with your luggage and transfer to your accommodation in Udaipur. Welcome to Udaipur, a city of royalties of ancient times known for the age-old temples, gorgeous lakes & gardens, and grandeur palaces & forts. We’ll immediately check-in after arriving at the hotel in Udaipur so you can rest and have an overnight stay in Udaipur.

23081.hl: The Pushkar Fair, also known as Pushkar Mela held every year between the months of October and November on the occasion of the holy Kartik Purnima over a period of seven days.
23081.ttl: Full Day Excursion to Ajmer & Pushkar - Departure from Jaipur
23081.dsc:
Enjoy your early breakfast at the hotel today before we check-out from the hotel. We’re going on a full-day excursion to Ajmer and Pushkar, with Ajmer comparatively bigger than Pushkar. While we’re here, we’re going to visit Ajmer Sharif Dargah, the dargah of Moinuddin Chishti. This is the tomb of Moinuddin Chishti from the 13th century, who was highly venerated throughout his reputation after arriving Delhi and later, Ajmer. Another site we’re going visit here is the Adhai Din Ka Johnpra, Ajmer’s oldest and historically rich mosque that was completed in 1192 by the commission of Qutb-ud-Din-Aibak. It was designed by Abu Bakr of Herat and is an exemplar mosque designed in Indo-Islamic style. Take a calming walk on the lakeside of Ana Sagar Lake, an artificial lake over 13km wide with an island in the center of it, made in the 12th century after a dam was built on Luni River.

Ajmer is the gateway to visit Pushkar, about 15km away, a famous, ancient Hindu pilgrimage city. It is home to more than 400 temples and we’re not going to miss the many ghats that can be seen here. We start from the center of the temples, the sacred Pushkar Lake, that’s believed to have medicinal properties for those who bath in one of the 52 bathing ghats. We’ll also be visiting the number of temples out of the hundreds that dot the surrounding of the lake. Rangji Temple is a temple dedicated to Lord Vaikuntha Venkatesh or Lord Rangji, an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. One of the most visually satisfying temples is the Man Mahal which features impressive Rajasthani architecture which also have gorgeous views of another nearby sacred lake. This palace cum hotel was built by Raja Man Singh I of Amber meant to serve as a temporary stay for his guests and himself when visiting Pushkar. Finally, we’re not going to miss the main attraction of Pushkar, the Temple of Lord Brahma, also known as Jagatpita Brahman Mandir, one of the rare, ancient temples dedicated to the Hindu Creator God. Then visit one last gorgeous pilgrimage site, Savitri Temple, which is dedicated to the Goddess Savitri. At the hilltop where you can get a dazzling view of Pushkar City and the surrounding mountain range when the weather is clear.

After the tour, we’ll transfer you to the airport or railway station for your departure. We know you’re heading back home with smiles from the awesome experience of this trip!
ntA: Brahma Temple remains closed from 1:30PM to 3PM
Ajmer Sharif remains closed from 3PM to 4PM
Boating is available in Ana Sagar Lake till 8PM. Boating Charges 160-200INR per person

51043.dsc: Arrival at Udaipur . Afterward, proceed to the hotel for your refreshment. Rest of the day is free at leisure by own arrangement. Back to the hotel, stay overnight.

24573.ttl: Transfer from Jaipur to Jodhpur and Departure from Jodhpur

24891.ttl: Full Day Trip to Ranthambore National Park (155km/3 hrs one way)
24891.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast today before we head out. We’re going on a full-day trip to Ranthambore National Park for an afternoon jeep safari at additional cost. Don’t miss out on the chance to see tigers and other wildlife at one of the finest tiger reserves in India. You can pick from a 20-seater Canter to a 6-seater Jeep to explore the place.

Morning safari is available from 7AM to 10.30AM and afternoon safari is from 2PM to 5.30PM. Wintertime schedule differs with the morning safari time delayed and evening exit time preponed.

Inside the National Park, we can find the Ranthambore Fort, a UNESCO’s Hill Forts of Rajasthan series: Ranthambore Fort. The fortress can be found within the Ranthambore National Park and houses a wide variety of tanks and temples. It remains as a wonder, archaeologically speaking, as it’s held itself very well since it was built in 944, until Akbar the Great in 1568. Within the temple is the Ganesha Temple which is the oldest one of Ganesha in Rajasthan made of red Karauli stone. It was built in 1300 AD by King Hammer who also filled it with the three-eyed Ganesha idol, Riddhi Siddhi (his wife), and two sons (Shub Labh).

Another place to visit inside the park is the Padam Talao Lake which is one of the largest lakes in the city. It’s also believed to be where Princess Padmavati bathe among the water lilies. It’s a beautiful sight, often surrounded by local wildlife who come for the water.

We’ll ride back to your hotel in Jaipur in the evening for your overnight stay.
ntA: Website for Safari Booking : Fmdss.forest.rajasthan.gov.in  /  https://www.tourism-of-india.com/wildlife/ranthambore.html
There are a limited number of vehicles allowed into the park, a maximum of 40 vehicles, 17 jeeps for tourist and 3 jeeps for VIP and 20 Canters at any one time.
Preferred safari zones are subject to availability until the drive.
Identity proof is must before entry into the park. Either Passport / Driving license / Pan Card / Voter Identity card / School ID / Government ID.

23059.hl: Boating is a popular activity in Lake Man Sagar at Jal Mahal
23059.ttl: Jaipur Half Day Sightseeing with Royal Gaitore
23059.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today in Jaipur. We’ll get ready for a full-day sightseeing around Jaipur, starting with Amer Fort. About 11km from the city, also known as the Amber Fort, there are four levels that you can explore here. When we enter the main complexes of the fort, we’ll get to explore the main hall, Diwan-i-Aam, which is meant for the gathering of the public. And the other hall, Diwan-i-Khas, is meant for private audience. There’s also the gorgeous Sheesh Mahal, also known as the Mirror Palace, where you can see the beautifully carved marble panel on a pillar in the shape of a “magic flower.” One can see seven beautiful forms carved: a lotus, a lion’s tail, a scorpion, a hooded cobra, a fishtail, a cob or corn, and an elephant trunk. One can also see the Maota Lake from the fort.

As we leave the fort, we’ll make a photo stop at Jal Mahal or Lake Palace of Jaipur where you can take beautiful pictures. Visitors can also boat around Lake Man Sagar to enjoy the view and atmosphere. Then visit the Royal Gaitor where we can see beautiful carved marble cenotaphs of the Maharaja of Jaipur. This serene scene is the perfect place where you can just take in the beauty of the place, far from the bustling city life.

Then we’re going to the ethnic village of Chokhi Dhani, a village resort where you can enjoy the culture, art, tradition, authentic cuisine, and many more in one place. At additional cost to enter the village, enjoy exploring the place and taste authentic Rajasthani cuisine while listening to the live folk dance and music, we’ll head back.

We’re going to drive back to your hotel in Jaipur for your overnight stay.

4949-1_25082024.i: Jal Mahal, Royal Gaitor Tumbas, Amber Fort are also covered on Day 5 (Jaipur Half Day Sightseeing - Departure from Jaipur)

ntA: Elephant Ride at Amer Fort is available only from 9AM to 12PM
Entry Charges for Amer Fort - Indian National Adult - Rs 100/- ; Child - Rs 10/-
Light & Sound Show Timings at Amer Fort - 07:30PM (English) & 08:00PM(Hindi). Entry Tickets Rs 200 INR for English show & 100 INR for Hindi show
Entry fee for Royal Gaitor (10 am to 5.30 pm on all days except Sunday ) - Adult Rs 30/-

19152.dsc: Spend the day at leisure, exploring Udaipur by your own.

23215.hl: The Shrinathji temple of Nathdwara is famous for the Shringar of the deity where the idol is dressed in a new dress every day. Devotees come from all over the world come to see the idol's different forms.
23215.ttl: Half day tour to  Nathdware and Eklingji
23215.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today as we prepare to set out on a day excursion to historical sites around Nathdwara and Eklingji. We start with the town of Eklingji where you can find the famous Eklingji Temple. It has been dubbed as the spiritual center of Mewar, a complex that was originally finished in the 8th century with 108 temples inside. It has been attacked several times and saw several changes of sect ownership, but the architecture remains a wonder to behold. Eklingji is a form of Shiv. In close proximity is Nathdwara, a town that’s very well known for its architectural feats and religious significance. It’s most known for the a 14th century temple of Lord Krishna with a Shrinathji idol in 7-year-old form of Lord Krishna.

We’ll ride back to Udaipur after exploring Nathdwara in the evening to visit Bhartiya Lok Kala Museum where we can see their unique collections of traditional artefacts, jewellery, ornaments, and many more traditionally important objects. Prepare for an evening trip to Lake Pichola and at an extra cost, you can even boat through the waters to enjoy the view. As the sun slowly sinks in the horizon, it turns the lakeside buildings and your surrounding golden. You can see the City Palace in the east and the gardens in the south. Head back to the hotel afterward for your overnight stay in Udaipur.
ntA: Darshan Timings for Eklingji Temple - Morning (4:30 am to 7:00 am ; 10:30 am to 1:30 pm) ; Evening 5:00 pm to 7:30 pm
Darshan Timings for Nathdwara Temple - Morning ( 05:45am to 06:30am ; 07:15am to 07:45am ; 09:15am to 09:30am ; 11:15am to 12:30pm ) ; Evening ( 03:45pm to 04:05pm; 05:15pm to 06:30pm )
Puppet Show at Bhartiya Lok kala Museum (6pm to 7pm) Entry fees Adult Rs 40/- ; Child Rs 20/-

19048.dsc: After breakfast, check-out from the hotel and drive towards Jaipur (400 kms / 7 hrs) enroute visiting Ajmer and Pushkar - major religious center for Muslim and Hindu Pilgrims respectively. We visit famous Dargah of Khwaja Muin-ud-din Chishti,Ajmer Sharif Dargah, the tomb of Moinuddin Chishti is one of the holiest places of worship in India not only for the Muslims but followers of every faith in Ajmer & World's only Lord Brahma Temple:being the only temple dedicated to Brahma in India, it attracts lakhs of pilgrims every year in Pushkar . Later we proceed to Jaipur, upon arrival check-in at the hotel. Overnight at Jaipur.
19048.ttl: Transfer From Udaipur To Jaipur Via Ajmer & Pushkar Sightseeing

18554.dsc: After breakfast check out and  proceed to  - Jaipur (400 kms / 7 hrs) the capital of Rajasthan - popularly known as the “Pink City”. On arrival at Jaipur, check into your hotel. Overnight stay at Jaipur.

23188.hl:
Embark on a 45min Sunset Boat Cruise on Lake Pichola and admire grandiose palaces on the lakeside (on direct payment)
Enjoy Puppet Show at Lok Kala Mandal - 12Pm to 1PM / 6PM to 7PM
23188.ttl: Arrival at Udaipur & Full Day Udaipur Sightseeing
23188.dsc:
Upon your arrival, our representatives will greet and help with your luggage and transfer to your accommodation in Udaipur. Welcome to Udaipur, a city of royalties of ancient times known for the age-old temples, gorgeous lakes & gardens, and grandeur palaces & forts. We’ll immediately check-in after arriving at the hotel in Udaipur so you can rest.

Get ready for a full-day sightseeing around Udaipur to get a taste of the legacy and history of this city. We’ll start from the City Palace of Udaipur, Rajasthan’s largest royal complex where Kings used to call home. Visitors can explore the various mahals, courtyards and pavilions built in this complex. Up at the highest point of the complex is the Amar Vilas that’s known for the beautiful hanging gardens. We’ll then visit Fateh Prakash Palace as well, a breathtaking site with an amazing view. Check out the inside of the Krishna Vilas chamber that houses a collection of miniature paintings. The elegant Manak Mahal lives up to its name, adorned with many red colored glass and mosaic. The Mor Chowk is a beautiful court that was built during the reign of Rana Karan Singhji. The Sheesh Mahal is a luxurious hotel that’s a pride of Udaipur. Near the edge of the City Palace is the Zenana Mahal which has been restored as a hotel. It used to serve as the palace for the royal ladies. We also won’t miss out on Sheesh Mahal and Rang Bhawan that brags exquisite view. At additional cost, we’ll also take you visit the Crystal Art Gallery that’s inside the Fateh Prakash Palace to see their crystal collection. The collection is over hundreds of years old and include a variety of objects d’art, dinner sets, perfume bottles, glasses, and more.

Then we’ll head over to the Jagdish Temple in Udaipur, a Hindu temple that’s been worshipped since 1651. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu who’s also known as the preserver of the universe. It is a Mewar dynasty’s architectural achievement as the 79-feet tall structure adorn the skyline of Udaipur.

Then visit Vintage Car Museum where any vintage car enthusiasts will love to check out their antique car collection. There are around 20 of them with 4 Rolls-Royce’s, 2 Cadillacs, and a lot of convertibles. We’ll make a photo stop at Nehru Garden which is located on an island within Fateh Sagar Lake. Enjoy the tranquil atmosphere of the artificial lake surrounded by Aravalli Hills and the calming ride to the island in the middle. Nehru Garden is a floating restaurant with garden in the shape of a boat.

Then we head to the gardens on the banks of Fateh Sagar Lake, Saheliyon-Ki-Bari, the Courtyard of Maiden. These gardens are built under the embankment of the lake and has beautiful lotus pools, marble pavilions and elephants, built in 1734 for the royal ladies. It was a present from Maharana Sangram Singh for his queen and her 48 maids. The tour continues to drive pass the Sukhadia Circle and we’ll then visit Bhartiya Lok Kala Museum where we can see their unique collections of traditional artefacts, jewellery, ornaments, and many more traditionally important objects.

And then visit Maharana Pratap Memorial and see a statue of Maharana Pratap sitting on Chetak, his horse. Enjoy the view of Fateh Sagar Lake and the rest of the city from here while relaxing in the tranquil atmosphere.

Prepare for an evening trip to Lake Pichola and at an extra cost, you can even boat through the waters to enjoy the view. As the sun slowly sinks in the horizon, it turns the lakeside buildings and your surrounding golden. You can see the City Palace in the east and the gardens in the south. Head back to the hotel afterward for your overnight stay in Udaipur.
ntA: Entry charges for City Palace & Museum (9:30am to 5:30pm) - Adult Rs 300/- ; Child Rs 100/-
Entry charges for Vintage Car Museum (9am to 9pm) - Adult Rs 250/- ; Child Rs 150/-
Entry charges for Crystal Gallery (9:30am to 6:30pm) - Adult Rs 300/- ; Child Rs 100/-
Entry charges for Bagore ki Haveli (9:30am to 5:30pm) - Adult Rs 50/- ; Child Rs 25/-
Puppet Show Charges at Lok Kala Mandal - Adult Rs 40/- & Child Rs 20/-

23189.hl: Jagdish Temple timings are 4.15am to 1pm & 5.15pm to 8pm. Open all days
23189.ttl: Arrival at Udaipur & Half Day Udaipur Sightseeing
23189.dsc:
Upon your arrival, our representatives will greet and help with your luggage and transfer to your accommodation in Udaipur. Welcome to Udaipur, a city of royalties of ancient times known for the age-old temples, gorgeous lakes & gardens, and grandeur palaces & forts. We’ll immediately check-in after arriving at the hotel in Udaipur so you can rest.

Get ready for a full-day sightseeing around Udaipur to get a taste of the legacy and history of this city. We’ll start from the City Palace of Udaipur, Rajasthan’s largest royal complex where Kings used to call home. Visitors can explore the various mahals, courtyards and pavilions built in this complex. Up at the highest point of the complex is the Amar Vilas that’s known for the beautiful hanging gardens. We’ll then visit Fateh Prakash Palace as well, a breathtaking site with an amazing view. Check out the inside of the Krishna Vilas chamber that houses a collection of miniature paintings. The elegant Manak Mahal lives up to its name, adorned with many red colored glass and mosaic. The Mor Chowk is a beautiful court that was built during the reign of Rana Karan Singhji. The Sheesh Mahal is a luxurious hotel that’s a pride of Udaipur. Near the edge of the City Palace is the Zenana Mahal which has been restored as a hotel. It used to serve as the palace for the royal ladies. We also won’t miss out on Sheesh Mahal and Rang Bhawan that brags exquisite view. At additional cost, we’ll also take you visit the Crystal Art Gallery that’s inside the Fateh Prakash Palace to see their crystal collection. The collection is over hundreds of years old and include a variety of objects d’art, dinner sets, perfume bottles, glasses, and more. Next to the palace are the Dilkhush Mahal and Moti Mahal where you can see unique mosaic of peacocks, paintings, and corking mirror works.

Then we’ll head over to the Jagdish Temple in Udaipur, a Hindu temple that’s been worshipped since 1651. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu who’s also known as the preserver of the universe. It is a Mewar dynasty’s architectural achievement as the 79-feet tall structure adorn the skyline of Udaipur.

Prepare for an evening trip to Lake Pichola and at an extra cost, you can even boat through the waters to enjoy the view. As the sun slowly sinks in the horizon, it turns the lakeside buildings and your surrounding golden. You can see the City Palace in the east and the gardens in the south. Head back to the hotel afterward for your overnight stay in Udaipur.
ntA: Entry charges for City Palace & Museum (9:30am to 5:30pm) - Adult Rs 300/- ; Child Rs 100/-
Entry charges for Crystal Gallery (9:30am to 6:30pm) - Adult Rs 300/- ; Child Rs 100/-

115219.dsc:
Enjoy your early breakfast today at the hotel and get ready for an excursion to Mount Abu which is about 3 hours away. Mount Abu is Rajasthan’s only hill station known not just for the stunning architecture, but also wondrous, panoramic view ant earned it the title “Oasis of Rajasthan.”

We’ll go on a full-day sightseeing around this gorgeous mountain, starting with the Dilwara Jain Temple. It has such a stunning architectural achievement made of white marbles and feature intricate carvings of lotuses, gods, and abstract patterns. The white tone is in line with the Svetambara branch the Dilwara temple is part of. We’ll get a good look of the Ranga Mandapa, the dome ceiling that has a chandelier-shaped structure where 16 stone idols of Vidya Devi are at.

Up the Aravalli Range is the peak of Guru Shikhar, the highest point of the mountain range which is about 15km from Mt. Abu. Up here, we can see the Mt. Abu Observatory as well as a cave temple of Lord Vishnu, Guru Dattatreya. The observatory has a great view of the night sky, bragging about 150 cloud-free nights every year and is equipped with a 1.2m Infrared telescope. Meanwhile the temple is a famous pilgrimage destination, built on the side of the mountain.

The day grows late as we slowly make our way to Honeymoon Point, also locally known as Anadara Point to enjoy the scenery. Unwind and rest here or snap some pictures with the Nakki Lake and Old Mt. Abu Gateway as your backdrop. We’ll head back to your hotel in the evening for your overnight stay in Udaipur.
ntA: This is a hectic itinerary and requires atleast 7-8 hours on the road, and not suggested.

23425.dsc: Reach Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan - popularly known as the “Pink City”. Check into your hotel. Overnight stay at hotel.
23425.ttl: Transfer from Udaipur to Jaipur(No Transfer)

34206.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast today before we head out on an excursion to Abhaneri. Also known as Abha Nagri, this is the “City of Light” which has seen a number of tourists and scholars visit for the ancient sculptures and sites. It is most popular for the Chand Baori stepwell which is about 30m into the ground, one of India’s deepest stepwell. The oldest parts of the structure can be dated back to the 8th century with additions continuously made until the 18th century.

It’s also known for the Harshat Mata Temple that’s built adjoined to the stepwell. The ritual is usually to wash one’s hands and feet at Chand Baori before entering the temple where Harshat Mata, the goddess of joy and happiness, is worshipped. It was built in the 8th century as well with a lot of damage done by Islamic invaders in 10th century. But what remained are still exemplars of Indian architecture from the 10th century.

We’ll ride back to your hotel in the evening for your overnight stay.

23060.hl: One of the famous items in the City Palace are two silver jars which have found place in the Guinness Book of World Records as the largest silver vessels in the world.
23060.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today before we head out exploring Jaipur. We’ll get ready for a half-day sightseeing around Jaipur starting with the City Palace. Today, it is still the home of Jaipur royal family and has an iconic pink faade and was built in 1732, or nearly 300 years ago after Jaipur became the capital city. We’ll visit the beautiful palaces in this complex, like the majestic Chandra Palace and Mubarak Palace. The Pritam Niwas Chowk is an enclosed courtyard, a beautiful 18th century garden with four elaborately decorated gateways where royal dance performances can be observed. The carriage house, Bhaggi Khana, is one of the museums where you can learn about the people who used to live there. We’re going to visit the Maharani Palace as well and finally, the 18th century Govind Dev Ji Temple which was built in the 18th century. It’s dedicated to Govind Dev who’s also Krishna, and his consort, Radha.

Visit the observatory of the founder of Jaipur, the Jantar Mantar, where you can find 20 astronomical instruments Rajput king Sawai Jai Singh II made and used. They are examples of the king’s innovations and great masonry works. We’ll make a photo stop at Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of Breeze, which is built at the edge of the City Palace where the royal ladies typically reside for “pardah” where they can observe street processions and other activities without revealing their face to the public.

The ride continues to Laxminarayan Temple. The Birla Mandir in Jaipur is praised for the glimmering shade of white marble, dedicated to the Hindu Goddess Lakshmi and Narayan, Lord Vishnu. Evening will for your own leisure activity in the city by exploring local markets for their apparels and handicrafts, or just to rest in your room before you get to enjoy delightful Rajasthani dinner. 

We’ll head back to your hotel in the evening for your overnight stay in Jaipur.
ntA: City Palace Museum & Jantar Mantar timings are 9.30AM to 5PM.  Last entry closes at 4PM
City Palace Museum a vast complex and takes around 2-3Hours to complete. So good walking shoes or flat footwear are preferred.
Entry Charges for City Palace Museum - Indian National Adult - Rs 130/- ; Child - Rs 50/-
Entry Charges for Jantar Mantar - Indian National Adult - Rs 50/- ; Child - Rs 15/-
Entry Charges for Hawa Mahal - Indian National Adult - Rs 50/- ; Child - Rs 5/-

23061.hl: Boating is a popular activity in Lake Man Sagar at Jal Mahal
23061.ttl: Jaipur Half Day Sightseeing - Departure from Jaipur
23061.dsc:
Enjoy your early breakfast at the hotel today before we check-out from the hotel. Get ready for a half-day sightseeing around Jaipur, starting with Amer Fort. About 11km from the city, also known as the Amber Fort, there are four levels that you can explore here. When we enter the main complexes of the fort, we’ll get to explore the main hall, Diwan-i-Aam, which is meant for the gathering of the public. And the other hall, Diwan-i-Khas, is meant for private audience. There’s also the gorgeous Sheesh Mahal, also known as the Mirror Palace, where you can see the beautifully carved marble panel on a pillar in the shape of a “magic flower.” One can see seven beautiful forms carved: a lotus, a lion’s tail, a scorpion, a hooded cobra, a fishtail, a cob or corn, and an elephant trunk. One can also see the Maota Lake from the fort.

As we leave the fort, we’ll make a photo stop at Jal Mahal or Lake Palace of Jaipur where you can take beautiful pictures. Visitors can also boat around Lake Man Sagar to enjoy the view and atmosphere. Then visit the Royal Gaitor where we can see beautiful carved marble cenotaphs of the Maharaja of Jaipur. This serene scene is the perfect place where you can just take in the beauty of the place, far from the bustling city life. The cenotaphs were erected at the foothills of the Nahargarh Fort just 15km from Jaipur.

After the sightseeing, we’re going to transport you to the airport or railway station for your departure. We know you’re heading back home with smiles from the awesome experience of this trip!
ntA: Elephant Ride at Amer Fort is available only from 9AM to 12PM
Entry Charges for Amer Fort - Indian National Adult - Rs 100/- ; Child - Rs 10/-
Light & Sound Show Timings at Amer Fort - 07:30PM (English) & 08:00PM(Hindi). Entry Tickets Rs 200 INR for English show & 100 INR for Hindi show
Entry fee for Royal Gaitor (10 am to 5.30 pm on all days except Sunday ) - Adult Rs 30/-

34208.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today before head out on a day tour. We’ll start with the Khatu Shyam Ji, one of the important pilgrim destinations in Rajasthan. Then we drive on to Jeen Mataji village, which is where an ancient temple of built around 1200 years ago can be found. Finally, we’re going to visit the only temple of Lord Hanuman with moustache and beards, the Salasar Balaji Temple. Located in the heart of Salasar town, the idol is said to have been unearthed from the fields of a farmer.

We will be heading back to our hotel in the evening. Spend your overnight in Jaipur.
34208.ttl: Full Day Tour To Khatushyamji, Jeen Mataji & Salasar Balaji

19136.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast today before we head out on a full-day excursion to Chittorgarh. We’re going to finally be where tales sung by Bards of Rajasthan all originate from. It is hard not to know about Chittorgarh Fort which is a hilltop hill that became the symbol of Rajput culture, a massive structure that saw the history and sacrifices of heroes of Rajput times. One can also see the seven gates throughout the 700-acre fort, each with their own names: Padan Gate, Ganesh Gate, Hanuman Gate, Bhairon Gate, Jodla Gate, Lakshman Gate, and Lord Ram Gate. Also known as the Water Fort, it is often targeted due to the strategic location of the fort that made it almost impenetrable. At the same time, there are many palaces and life inside the fort is comfortable as it contains 84 bodies of water and 22 of them still exist today.

There’s a lot to see inside the fort and we’ll visit some of them. The Padmini Palace is a white building from the 19th century where Rani Padmini lived after marrying Rawal Ratan Singh in 1300 CE. Another palace is the Rana Kumbha Palace near the entrance gate, by the Victory Tower “Vijay Stambha.”. The Fateh Prakash Palace inside the fort has been converted into a museum that houses a range of ancient artifacts in the form of old coins, sculptures and other crafts. The 8th century Kalika Mata Temple still stands inside the fort with new parts added much later. The Meera Bai Temple is another old Hindu temple dedicated to Meera Bai who was a devotee of Lord Krishna. Another notable tower is the Kirti Stambha from the 12th century by a Jain merchant to celebrate Jainism. It features fantastic sculptures of Hindu deities and stores from the Ramayana and Mahabharata.

After the fort, it’s time to explore the nature of this land by visiting Bassi Wildlife Sanctuary. This is a wildlife sanctuary with dry forests that are natural habitats for Dhok, Churel, Butea, wild cats, civets, hyenas, foxes, Chitals, and more. We can ride through the sanctuary to see the Bassi and Orai Dams that formed reservoirs where animals frequently visit for water.

We’ll ride back to the hotel in the evening for your overnight stay in Udaipur.

18566.hl:
Embark on a 45min Sunset Boat Cruise on Lake Pichola and admire grandiose palaces on the lakeside (on direct payment)
Enjoy Puppet Show at Lok Kala Mandal - 12Pm to 1PM / 6PM to 7PM
18566.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today before we head out. Get ready for a full-day sightseeing around Udaipur to get a taste of the legacy and history of this city. We’ll start from the City Palace of Udaipur, Rajasthan’s largest royal complex where Kings used to call home. Visitors can explore the various mahals, courtyards and pavilions built in this complex. Up at the highest point of the complex is the Amar Vilas that’s known for the beautiful hanging gardens. We’ll then visit Fateh Prakash Palace as well, a breathtaking site with an amazing view. Check out the inside of the Krishna Vilas chamber that houses a collection of miniature paintings. The elegant Manak Mahal lives up to its name, adorned with many red colored glass and mosaic. The Mor Chowk is a beautiful court that was built during the reign of Rana Karan Singhji. The Sheesh Mahal is a luxurious hotel that’s a pride of Udaipur. Near the edge of the City Palace is the Zenana Mahal which has been restored as a hotel. It used to serve as the palace for the royal ladies. We also won’t miss out on Sheesh Mahal and Rang Bhawan that brags exquisite view.

Then we’ll head over to the Jagdish Temple in Udaipur, a Hindu temple that’s been worshipped since 1651. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu who’s also known as the preserver of the universe. It is a Mewar dynasty’s architectural achievement as the 79-feet tall structure adorn the skyline of Udaipur.

Then visit Vintage Car Museum where any vintage car enthusiasts will love to check out their antique car collection. There are around 20 of them with 4 Rolls-Royce’s, 2 Cadillacs, and a lot of convertibles.

We’ll make a photo stop at Nehru Garden which is located on an island within Fateh Sagar Lake. Enjoy the tranquil atmosphere of the artificial lake surrounded by Aravalli Hills and the calming ride to the island in the middle. Nehru Garden is a floating restaurant with garden in the shape of a boat. Then we head to the gardens on the banks of Fateh Sagar Lake, Saheliyon-Ki-Bari, the Courtyard of Maiden. These gardens are built under the embankment of the lake and has beautiful lotus pools, marble pavilions and elephants, built in 1734 for the royal ladies. It was a present from Maharana Sangram Singh for his queen and her 48 maids.

Visit the craftsmen of Shilpgram where you can watch men at work, demonstrating their dexterity in handcrafting. This heritage village was established in 1989 has audio-visual centers with documentaries on the history and tradition of Indian art and craft. You can also bring home with your something to remember the trip by here!

Prepare for an evening trip to Lake Pichola and at an extra cost, you can even boat through the waters to enjoy the view. As the sun slowly sinks in the horizon, it turns the lakeside buildings and your surrounding golden. You can see the City Palace in the east and the gardens in the south. Head back to the hotel afterward for your overnight stay in Udaipur.

5079-0_23082024.i: Bhartiya Lok Kala Mandal, Fateh Sagar, City Palace of Udaipur are also covered on Day 1 (Arrival at Udaipur & Full Day Udaipur Sightseeing)

ntA: Entry charges for City Palace & Museum (9:30am to 5:30pm) - Adult Rs 300/- ; Child Rs 100/-
Entry charges for Vintage Car Museum (9am to 9pm) - Adult Rs 250/- ; Child Rs 150/-
Entry charges for Crystal Gallery (9:30am to 6:30pm) - Adult Rs 300/- ; Child Rs 100/-
Entry charges for Bagore ki Haveli (9:30am to 5:30pm) - Adult Rs 50/- ; Child Rs 25/-
Puppet Show Charges at Lok Kala Mandal - Adult Rs 40/- & Child Rs 20/-

18445.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast today before we head out on an excursion to Sanganer, a place about 12km from Jaipur. Sanganer is a place famous for the textile, papermaking, and blue pottery. And while we’re here, we’re going to check out all famous attractions around here. The Kaghzi Mohalla is a great place to start where we can learn about the artisans of handmade paper that has become a famous product of this place. Sanganer textiles are also popular among tourists because of the beautiful hand-printed designs and bright colors used. You’ll also find the block prints here famous as well.

We’ll explore the old city in the late afternoon to check out the lively markets where you can shop for the textiles and other local products and souvenirs here. You can see the craftsmen at work as you go from one shop to another. And then we’re going to give one of the famous temples, Shri Digamber Jain Temple, a visit. It is built in the 10th century where you can see many intricate carvings on the walls and is known to have seven underground floors.

See all the interesting things Sanganer town has to offer on this trip before we ride back to Jaipur. You have evening for leisure to explore the place on your own or rest in your room before spending the night in Jaipur.

18567.hl: Jagdish Temple timings are 4.15am to 1pm & 5.15pm to 8pm. Open all days
18567.dsc:

We’ll start from the City Palace of Udaipur, Rajasthan’s largest royal complex where Kings used to call home. Visitors can explore the various mahals, courtyards and pavilions built in this complex. Up at the highest point of the complex is the Amarvilas that’s known for the beautiful hanging gardens. We’ll then visit Fateh Prakash Palace as well, a breathtaking site with an amazing view. Check out the inside of the Krishna Vilas chamber that houses a collection of miniature paintings. The elegant Manak Mahal lives up to its name, adorned with many red colored glass and mosaic. The Mor Chowk is a beautiful court that was built during the reign of Rana Karan Singhji. The Sheesh Mahal is a luxurious hotel that’s a pride of Udaipur. Near the edge of the City Palace is the Zenana Mahal which has been restored as a hotel. It used to serve as the palace for the royal ladies. We also won’t miss out on Sheesh Mahal and Rang Bhawan that brags exquisite view. At additional cost, we’ll also take you visit the Crystal Art Gallery that’s inside the Fateh Prakash Palace to see their crystal collection. The collection is over hundreds of years old and include a variety of objects d’art, dinner sets, perfume bottles, glasses, and more. Next to the palace are the Dilkhush Mahal and Moti Mahal where you can see unique mosaic of peacocks, paintings, and corking mirror works.

Then we’ll head over to the Jagdish Temple in Udaipur, a Hindu temple that’s been worshipped since 1651. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu who’s also known as the preserver of the universe. It is a Mewar dynasty’s architectural achievement as the 79-feet tall structure adorn the skyline of Udaipur.

Evening is for you to spend at leisure to explore the area on your own or to just relax somewhere. Head back to the hotel afterward for your overnight stay in Udaipur.

5079-0_23082024.i: City Palace of Udaipur is also covered on Day 1 (Arrival at Udaipur & Full Day Udaipur Sightseeing)

ntA: Entry charges for City Palace & Museum (9:30am to 5:30pm) - Adult Rs 300/- ; Child Rs 100/-
Entry charges for Crystal Gallery (9:30am to 6:30pm) - Adult Rs 300/- ; Child Rs 100/-

19138.hl: The Shrinathji temple of Nathdwara is famous for the Shringar of the deity where the idol is dressed in a new dress every day. Devotees come from all over the world come to see the idol's different forms.
19138.ttl: Day Excursion to Eklingji, Haldighati and Nathdwara
19138.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today as we prepare to set out on a day excursion to Haldighati, Nathdwara and Eklingji. We start with the town of Eklingji where you can find the famous Eklingji Temple. It has been dubbed as the spiritual center of Mewar, a complex that was originally finished in the 8th century with 108 temples inside. It has been attacked several times and saw several changes of sect ownership, but the architecture remains a wonder to behold. Eklingji is a form of Shiv.

Then head over to Haldighati, a historical mountain pass that was also the site where the Battle of Haldighati took place. Just less than 500 years ago, this was where Maharana Pratap and the Mughal Emperor Akbar fought in 1576 AD. In close proximity is Nathdwara, a town that’s very well known for its architectural feats and religious significance. It’s most known for the a 14th century temple of Lord Krishna with a Shrithnaji idol in 7-year-old form of Lord Krishna.

We’ll ride back to Udaipur after exploring the town for your overnight stay at the hotel.
ntA: Darshan Timings for Eklingji Temple - Morning (4:30 am to 7:00 am ; 10:30 am to 1:30 pm) ; Evening 5:00 pm to 7:30 pm
Darshan Timings for Nathdwara Temple - Morning ( 05:45am to 06:30am ; 07:15am to 07:45am ; 09:15am to 09:30am ; 11:15am to 12:30pm ) ; Evening ( 03:45pm to 04:05pm; 05:15pm to 06:30pm )

19017.hl: One of the famous items in the City Palace are two silver jars which have found place in the Guinness Book of World Records as the largest silver vessels in the world.
19017.ttl: Half Day Sightseeing - Departure from Jaipur to Delhi
19017.dsc:
Enjoy your early breakfast at the hotel today before we check-out from the hotel. Get ready for a half-day sightseeing around Jaipur starting with the City Palace. Today, it is still the home of Jaipur royal family and has an iconic pink faade and was built in 1732, or nearly 300 years ago after Jaipur became the capital city. 

Visit the observatory of the founder of Jaipur, the Jantar Mantar, where you can find 20 astronomical instruments Rajput king Sawai Jai Singh II made and used. They are examples of the king’s innovations and great masonry works. We’ll also visit the Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of Breeze, which is built at the edge of the City Palace where the royal ladies typically reside for “pardah” where they can observe street processions and other activities without revealing their face to the public.

Enjoy your lunch before we continue our ride for Delhi where we’ll drop you at the airport or railway station for your departure. We know you’re heading back home with smiles from the awesome experience of this trip!

4949-1_26082024.e: Choose a Transport option with drop at Delhi

Entry Charges for City Palace Museum - Indian National Adult - Rs 130/- ; Child - Rs 50/-
Entry Charges for Jantar Mantar - Indian National Adult - Rs 50/- ; Child - Rs 15/-
Entry Charges for Hawa Mahal - Indian National Adult - Rs 50/- ; Child - Rs 5/-

19012.dsc: Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today before we check-out. Get ready for your 6-hour ride that’ll take you directly to Delhi Airport or Railway Station for your scheduled departure. We know you’re heading back home with smiles from the awesome experience of this trip!

4949-1_26082024.e: Choose a Transport option with drop at Delhi

19012.ttl: Transfer from Jaipur to Delhi - Departure from Delhi

19011.hl: The Pushkar Fair, also known as Pushkar Mela held every year between the months of October and November on the occasion of the holy Kartik Purnima over a period of seven days.
19011.ttl: Full Day Excursion to Ajmer & Pushkar
19011.dsc:
Enjoy your early breakfast at the hotel today before we head out. We’re going on a full-day excursion to Ajmer and Pushkar, with Ajmer comparatively bigger than Pushkar. While we’re here, we’re going to visit Ajmer Sharif Dargah, the dargah of Moinuddin Chishti. This is the tomb of Moinuddin Chishti from the 13th century, who was highly venerated throughout his reputation after arriving Delhi and later, Ajmer. Another site we’re going visit here is the Adhai Din Ka Jhonpra, Ajmer’s oldest and historically rich mosque that was completed in 1192 by the commission of Qutb-ud-Din-Aibak. It was designed by Abu Bakr of Herat and is an exemplar mosque designed in Indo-Islamic style. Take a calming walk on the lakeside of Ana Sagar Lake, an artificial lake over 13 km wide with an island in the center of it, made in the 12th century after a dam was built on Luni River.

Ajmer is the gateway to visit Pushkar, about 15km away, a famous, ancient Hindu pilgrimage city. It is home to more than 400 temples and we’re not going to miss the many ghats that can be seen here. We start from the center of the temples, the sacred Pushkar Lake, that’s believed to have medicinal properties for those who bath in one of the 52 bathing ghats. We’ll also be visiting the number of temples out of the hundreds that dot the surrounding of the lake. Rangji Temple is a temple dedicated to Lord Vaikuntha Venkatesh or Lord Rangji, an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. One of the most visually satisfying temples is the Man Mahal which features impressive Rajasthani architecture which also have gorgeous views of another nearby sacred lake. This palace cum hotel was built by Raja Man Singh I of Amber meant to serve as a temporary stay for his guests and himself when visiting Pushkar. Finally, we’re not going to miss the main attraction of Pushkar, the Temple of Lord Brahma, also known as Jagatpita Brahman Mandir, one of the rare, ancient temples dedicated to the Hindu Creator God. Then visit one last gorgeous pilgrimage site, Savitri Temple, which is dedicated to the Goddess Savitri. At the hilltop where you can get a dazzling view of Pushkar City and the surrounding mountain range when the weather is clear.

We’ll head back to your hotel in the evening for your overnight stay in Jaipur.
ntA: Brahma Temple remains closed from 1:30PM to 3PM
Ajmer Sharif remains closed from 3PM to 4PM
Boating is available in Ana Sagar Lake till 8PM. Boating Charges 160-200INR per person

18442.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today before we head out exploring Jaipur. We’ll get ready for a full-day sightseeing around Jaipur, starting with Amer Fort. About 11km from the city, also known as the Amber Fort, there are four levels that you can explore here. Visitors can pay for an Elephant ride experience, a unique way to explore the place. One can also see the Maota Lake from the fort. On the lake is the Kesar Kyari Garden which was created in the 1600 for the harem to enjoy the view a pulley system that transports the ladies safely here without having to meet men.

We’ll head out to visit the Shila Devi Temple, housing an idol of Durga brought here in the early 1600s. Raja Man Singh I had brought the statue in as a promise for winning against King Kedar and it is now in the sanctum.

There’s also the gorgeous Sheesh Mahal, also known as the Mirror Palace, where you can see the beautifully carved marble panel on a pillar in the shape of a “magic flower.” One can see seven beautiful forms carved: a lotus, a lion’s tail, a scorpion, a hooded cobra, a fishtail, a cob or corn, and an elephant trunk.

The Panna Meena Bawri is a stepwell meant as a bathing place for Indian Queens and you can see what would’ve been a very exclusive site back in the days. Visit the Man Sagar Lake, a manmade lake which was created by raja Man Singh in 1610 after a dam was created on the Dravyavati river.

Additionally, if we weren’t able to explore these places, we’ll also head to the City Palace. Today, it is still the home of Jaipur royal family and has an iconic pink faade and was built in 1732, or nearly 300 years ago after Jaipur became the capital city. There’s also Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of Breeze, which is built at the edge of the City Palace where the royal ladies typically reside for “pardah” where they can observe street processions and other activities without revealing their face to the public.

We’ll ride back in the evening to your hotel for your overnight stay in Jaipur.

4949-1_25082024.i: Jal Mahal, Amber Fort are also covered on Day 5 (Jaipur Half Day Sightseeing - Departure from Jaipur); Gaitor, Laxmi Naryan Temple - Closed

ntA: Elephant Ride at Amer Fort is available only from 9:30AM to 1PM
Laxmi Narayan Temple is closed from 12PM to 4PM everyday
City Palace Museum & Jantar Mantar timings are 9.30AM to 5PM.  Last entry closes at 4PM
City Palace Museum a vast complex and takes around 2-3Hours to complete. So good walking shoes or flat footwear are preferred.
Entry Charges for City Palace Museum - Indian National Adult - Rs 130/- ; Child - Rs 50/-
Entry Charges for Jantar Mantar - Indian National Adult - Rs 50/- ; Child - Rs 15/-
Entry Charges for Hawa Mahal - Indian National Adult - Rs 50/- ; Child - Rs 5/-
Entry Charges for Amer Fort - Indian National Adult - Rs 100/- ; Child - Rs 10/-

23232.hl: The Shrinathji temple of Nathdwara is famous for the Shringar of the deity where the idol is dressed in a new dress every day. Devotees come from all over the world come to see the idol's different forms.
23232.ttl: Day Excursion to Kumbhalgarh via Nathdwara & Eklingji
23232.dsc:
Enjoy your breakfast at the hotel today as we prepare to set out on a day excursion to historical sites around Kumbhalgarh, Nathdwara and Eklingji. We start with Nathdwara, a town that’s very well known for its architectural feats and religious significance. It’s most known for the a 14th century temple of Lord Krishna with a Shrinathji idol in 7-year-old form of Lord Krishna. In close proximity is the town of Eklingji where you can find the famous Eklingji Temple. It has been dubbed as the spiritual center of Mewar, a complex that was originally finished in the 8th century with 108 temples inside. It has been attacked several times and saw several changes of sect ownership, but the architecture remains a wonder to behold. Eklingji is a form of Shiv.

Then finally, we’ll reach today’s highlight: UNESCO World Heritage Site Kumbhalgarh Fort. This medieval hilltop fortress is one of Rajasthan’s most beautiful and important historical sites. It has been dubbed the Great Wall of Indian and is indeed, the world’s second-longest wall with seven fortified gateways. It’ll take a whole day to walk and explore the inner palaces, temples, courts, while we enjoy the view on the outside. Explore Palace of the Clouds or Badal Mahal which is the fort’s highest point with exquisite view of Thar Desert and Aravalli Range. It is also said the legendary warrior Maharana Pratap was born here. Before we leave, we’re going to attend the 45-minute Light and Sound show at the fort that tells the history of the fort and more.

We’ll ride back to Udaipur after exploring the fort for your overnight stay at the hotel.
ntA: Darshan Timings for Eklingji Temple - Morning (4:30 am to 7:00 am ; 10:30 am to 1:30 pm) ; Evening 5:00 pm to 7:30 pm
Darshan Timings for Nathdwara Temple - Morning ( 05:45am to 06:30am ; 07:15am to 07:45am ; 09:15am to 09:30am ; 11:15am to 12:30pm ) ; Evening ( 03:45pm to 04:05pm; 05:15pm to 06:30pm )
Kumbhalgarh Fort Light and Sound show is conducted everyday at 18:45PM. Entry charges 200 INR

24288.dsc:
Upon your arrival in Gandhinagar, our representatives will greet and help with your luggage and transfer to your accommodation in Udaipur which is about 4.5 hours away. Welcome to Udaipur, a city of royalties of ancient times known for the age-old temples, gorgeous lakes & gardens, and grandeur palaces & forts. We’ll immediately check-in after arriving at the hotel in Udaipur so you can rest.

Prepare for an evening trip to Lake Pichola and at an extra cost, you can even boat through the waters to enjoy the view. As the sun slowly sinks in the horizon, it turns the lakeside buildings and your surrounding golden. You can see the City Palace in the east and the gardens in the south. Head back to the hotel afterward for your overnight stay in Udaipur.
